## Description {#details}

The size of an allocated array is represented by a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayrecycler/capacity">Capacity</a> instance.

This class is much smaller than a size&#95;t, and it provides methods to work with the set of legal array capacities.

Definition at line 71 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/arrayrecycler-h">ArrayRecycler.h</a>.

### getNext() {#a1d916c19b79f38116c50c3f5a23c12ec}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Capacity llvm::ArrayRecycler&lt; T, Align &gt;::Capacity::getNext () const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Get the next larger capacity.

Large capacities grow exponentially, so this function can be used to reallocate incrementally growing vectors in amortized linear time.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/arrayrecycler-h/#l00092">92</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/arrayrecycler-h">ArrayRecycler.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
